reviews.text: Reasonably well-planned and executed, though not with that much thought given to extending the reinstated section of line further south at some point. The very long platforms, however, allow for the running of the occasional steam special. Unlike other stations on the line there is also a toilet here, although the restricted “opening hours“ (as the notice on the door puts it) and the fact only one person at a time can be accommodated doubtless give rise to some public inconvenience at times. The adjacent car park is free and of ample size.
Main station for the Borders. Not alot here but close to Abbotsford House.

It was great to have not far from our accommodation, easy to use and purchase your ticket on board not at the station.   My only complaint is, it was very busy with only 2 carriages now considering it was school holidays, fringe festival and high tourist season another carriage in my opinion was needed.  This had obviously been an ongoing problem as on our return they apologised for the overcrowding!

Excellent location for walks along the Tweed to Melrose. For Taxi's Google local taxi firm Allied Cabs (Local area only) 5 Minutes train run to the shops in Galashiels or under an hour to Edinburgh City Centre.
